10437: Thir own Faith not anothers: for on Earth
10438: Who against Faith and Conscience can be heard
10441: On all who in the worship persevere
10442: Of Spirit and Truth; the rest, farr greater part,
10443: Will deem in outward Rites and specious formes
10445: Bestuck with slandrous darts, and works of Faith
10446: Rarely be found: so shall the World goe on,
10447: To good malignant, to bad men benigne,
10448: Under her own waight groaning, till the day
10449: Appeer of respiration to the just,
10450: And vengeance to the wicked, at return
10451: Of him so lately promis'd to thy aid,
10452: The Womans seed, obscurely then foretold,
10453: Now amplier known thy Saviour and thy Lord,
10454: Last in the Clouds from Heav'n to be reveald
10455: In glory of the Father, to dissolve
10456: *Satan* with his perverted World, then raise
10457: From the conflagrant mass, purg'd and refin'd,
10458: New Heav'ns, new Earth, Ages of endless date
10459: Founded in righteousness and peace and love,
10460: To bring forth fruits Joy and eternal Bliss.
10462: How soon hath thy prediction, Seer blest,
10463: Measur'd this transient World, the Race of time,
10464: Till time stand fixt: beyond is all abyss,
10465: Eternitie, whose end no eye can reach.
10466: Greatly instructed I shall hence depart,
10467: Greatly in peace of thought, and have my fill
10468: Of knowledge, what this vessel can containe;
10469: Beyond which was my folly to aspire.
10470: Henceforth I learne, that to obey is best,
10471: And love with feare the onely God, to walk
10472: As in his presence, ever to observe
10473: His providence, and on him sole depend,
10474: Merciful over all his works, with good
10475: Still overcoming evil, and by small
10476: Accomplishing great things, by things deemd weak
10477: Subverting worldly strong, and worldly wise
10478: By simply meek; that suffering for Truths sake
10480: And to the faithful Death the Gate of Life;
10481: Taught this by his example whom I now
10483: ¶To whom thus also th' Angel last repli'd:
10484: This having learnt, thou hast attaind the summe
10485: Of wisdom; hope no higher, though all the Starrs
10486: Thou knewst by name, and all th' ethereal Powers,
10487: All secrets of the deep, all Natures works,
10488: Or works of God in Heav'n, Air, Earth, or Sea,
10489: And all the riches of this World enjoydst,
10490: And all the rule, one Empire; onely add
10491: Deeds to thy knowledge answerable, add Faith,
10492: Add Vertue, Patience, Temperance, add Love,
10493: By name to come call'd Charitie, the soul
10494: Of all the rest: then wilt thou not be loath
10495: To leave this Paradise, but shalt possess
10496: A Paradise within thee, happier farr.
10497: Let us descend now therefore from this top
10498: Of Speculation; for the hour precise
10499: Exacts our parting hence; and see the Guards,
10500: By mee encampt on yonder Hill, expect
10501: Thir motion, at whose Front a flaming Sword,
10502: In signal of remove, waves fiercely round;
10503: We may no longer stay: go, waken Eve;
10504: Her also I with gentle Dreams have calm'd
10505: Portending good, and all her spirits compos'd
10506: To meek submission: thou at season fit
10507: Let her with thee partake what thou hast heard,
10508: Chiefly what may concern her Faith to know,
10509: The great deliverance by her Seed to come
10510: (For by the Womans Seed) on all Mankind.
10511: That ye may live, which will be many dayes,
10512: Both in one Faith unanimous though sad,
10513: With cause for evils past, yet much more cheer'd
10514: With meditation on the happie end.
10515: ¶He ended, and they both descend the Hill;
10517: Lay sleeping ran before, but found her wak't;
10518: And thus with words not sad she him receav'd.
10519: ¶Whence thou returnst, & whither wentst, I know;
10520: For God is also in sleep, and Dreams advise,
10521: Which he hath sent propitious, some great good
10522: Presaging, since with sorrow and hearts distress
10523: Wearied I fell asleep: but now lead on;
10524: In mee is no delay; with thee to goe,
10525: Is to stay here; without thee here to stay,
10526: Is to go hence unwilling; thou to mee
10527: Art all things under Heav'n, all places thou,
10528: Who for my wilful crime art banisht hence.
10530: I carry hence; though all by mee is lost,
10531: Such favour I unworthie am voutsaft,
10532: By mee the Promis'd Seed shall all restore.
10534: Well pleas'd, but answer'd not; for now too nigh
10535: Th' Archangel stood, and from the other Hill
10536: To thir fixt Station, all in bright array
10537: The Cherubim descended; on the ground
10539: Ris'n from a River o're the marish glides,
10540: And gathers ground fast at the Labourers heel
10541: Homeward returning.  High in Front advanc't,
10542: The brandisht Sword of God before them blaz'd
10543: Fierce as a Comet; which with torrid heat,
10544: And vapour as the *Libyan* Air adust,
10545: Began to parch that temperate Clime; whereat
10546: In either hand the hastning Angel caught
10547: Our lingring Parents, and to th' Eastern Gate
10548: Let them direct, and down the Cliff as fast
10549: To the subjected Plaine; then disappeer'd.
10550: They looking back, all th' Eastern side beheld
10551: Of Paradise, so late thir happie seat,
10552: Wav'd over by that flaming Brand, the Gate
10553: With dreadful Faces throng'd and fierie Armes:
10554: Som natural tears they drop'd, but wip'd them soon;
10555: The World was all before them, where to choose
10556: Thir place of rest, and Providence thir guide:
10557: They hand in hand with wandring steps and slow,
